Dead By Daylight is a really fun game. I enjoy it a lot. However, there are some pretty distinct pros and cons to consider, so I'll list those below.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
[list]
[*]Appealing to those who want to play with (up to 3 other) friends [b]OR[/b] solo (as killer)
[*]Doesn't have difficult or over-complicated movement and basic controls
[*]High skill ceiling and plenty of tactics to learn and perfect
[*]Wins can feel extremely satisfying
[*]Wide variety of characters, including licensed ones from popular slasher/horror films
[*]Good way to ease into the horror genre without it being [i]too[/i] spooky. Less ambiance than games like Amnesia:TDD + the fact that killers are actual players make certain moments more comedic than terrifying.
[/list]

[h1] Cons [/h1]
[list]
[*]Queue times can be long, particularly as survivor
[*]Matchmaking can be a little wonky (sometimes you're paired up with players well above or well below your skill level; this is especially true for killer players)
[*]Much higher hour count needed to feel truly "good" at the game (plenty of top players have 3k+ hours under their belt and their gameplay reflects this)
[*]There is quite a bit of lingering toxicity and creepishness in the community. No matter how the game plays out, you'll have people getting angry and BMing left and right. This is ALSO the game that made me make my 6-year-old steam account private due to having people investigating my account before or after the game. Not sure if any of this will be better addressed in future updates.
[*]Technically pay-to-play. While most characters you can acquire using the fairly-abundant free currency, there are several META [spoiler]meaning: Most Effective Tactic Available[/spoiler] perks that come with certain licensed characters that absolutely must be bought with real money (example: The Cannibal perk Barbecue & Chili, from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre movie series). While it can be argued that you can play without those perks, the truth is that many people at higher ranks use them, and sometimes it can be frustrating to go without, making it fall into that P2P category. Yes, the packs aren't too expensive, but that doesn't dismiss the fact that some game content is definitely paid for.
[/list]

[h1] Final Thoughts [/h1]
Sitting at a measly (haha) 110 hours at the time of this review, I'd say that I'm still a beginner at this game. I may come back and update my feedback as I play and grow more experienced. That being said, if you're someone that likes to sink a lot of time in a single game and really feel it when you're making progress, I think you'll like this game. If you like your games to be less mechanically-complex but with plenty of depth and lots to learn, you'll probably find Dead By Daylight a great time. I'm enjoying it, so I'm giving it a thumbs up. But if the cons I've listed above are things that you think you'd find frustrating, I'd definitely think carefully before purchasing.

Игра явно стоит своих денег.
Стабильный онлайн в 40к, много интересных локаций, разнообразие манов и перков на сурвах, увлекательный геймплей.
Но есть и минусы: баги, отвратительный мачмейкинг( к 12 рангу спокойно кидает манов 1), баланс.
А главная проблема этой игры - её конченое комьюнити.  Стадо нытиков и токсиков будут встречаться вам в каждой второй катке.

The first 50 hours spent in dead by daylight are nothing short of terrifying. You hide in lockers and behind trees, praying the killer won't notice your butt sticking out. But you soon realize that you don't need to fear the killer, you learn how to interact with the environment to transform what started as a hide and seek into an intricate game of cat and mouse.

That's where skill is introduced, that's where people start trying, and that's where things start falling apart.

This game was simply not made with the idea that people would actually care about winning. The developers and the game itself refuse to even define what a win is. This blurs the line between bm and optimal strategy, as both killers and survivors can abuse the game's flaws to steal the other side's shot at having a fair game.

These issues have been crippling the game since 2016 and because of the lack of competition in the assymetrical horror pvp genre the devs have never had a reason to get out of their comfort zone and experiment with ways of fixing the game's core problems.
